content.html:
Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

In questions 1–4, determine if the following points are solutions to the given system of equations.

1. \(\left\{\begin{array}{l}2x-6y=0\\3x-4y=5\end{array}\right.\)

(3,1)

Correct! (3,1)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.1.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Yes. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?



2. \(\left\{\begin{array}{l}2x-6y=0\\3x-4y=5\end{array}\right.\)

(-3,4)

Correct! (-3,4)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.1.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is No. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?



3. \(\left\{\begin{array}{l}x+y=2\\y=\frac34x\end{array}\right.\)

\((\frac87,\;\frac67)\)

Correct! \((\frac87,\;\frac67)\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.1.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Yes. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?



4. \(\left\{\begin{array}{l}x+y=2\\y=\frac34x\end{array}\right.\)

\(\left(1,\frac34\right)\)

Correct! \(\left(1,\frac34\right)\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.1.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is No. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?



In questions 5-10, solve the systems of equations by graphing.

5. \(\left\{\begin{array}{l}3x+y=-3\\2x+3y=5\end{array}\right.\)

Correct! \((-2,3)\)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.1.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is (−2,3). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?



6. \(\left\{\begin{array}{l}y=x+2\\y=-2x+2\end{array}\right.\)

Correct! \((0,2)\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.1.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is (0,2). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?



7. \(\left\{\begin{array}{l}y=\frac32x+1\\y=-\frac12x+5\end{array}\right.\)

Correct! \((2,4)\)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.1.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is (2,4). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?



8. \(\left\{\begin{array}{l}x+y=-4\\-x+2y=-2\end{array}\right.\)

Correct! \((-2,-2)\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.1.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is (-2,-2). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?



9. \(\left\{\begin{array}{l}-2x+3y=3\\x+3y=12\end{array}\right.\)

Correct! \((3,3)\)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.1.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is (3,3). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?



10. \(\left\{\begin{array}{l}2x-4y=8\\x+3y=9\end{array}\right.\)

Correct! \((6,1)\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.1.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is (6,1). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?



11. A bakery charges $2 per croissant and $4 per muffin. One day, they charge $42 in total and sell 15 baked goods. How many croissants and muffins did they sell?

Correct! 9 croissants and 6 muffins

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.1.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is 9 croissants and 6 muffins. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

12. A pet store sells mice for $7 each and gerbils for $9 each. They sell 17 animals for a total of $137. How many mice and gerbils do they sell?

Correct! 8 mice and 9 gerbils

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.1.3 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 8 mice and 9 gerbils. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?
